trans-unit.source: Using the POP3 Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the POP3 Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the POP3 Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the POP3 Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the POP3 Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the POP3 Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to a POP3 server to retrieve emails, including emails with attachments.
trans-unit.target: Connect to a POP3 server to retrieve emails, including emails with attachments.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can add the POP3 Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the POP3 Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Creating an POP3 connector for your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Creating an POP3 connector for your Logic App

trans-unit.source: To use the POP3 connector, you need to first create an instance of the POP3 connector API app.
trans-unit.target: To use the POP3 connector, you need to first create an instance of the POP3 connector API app.

trans-unit.source: This can be done from either the logic app designer directly or outside it.
trans-unit.target: This can be done from either the logic app designer directly or outside it.

trans-unit.source: Creating an instance outside the designer can be done as follows:
trans-unit.target: Creating an instance outside the designer can be done as follows:

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure Marketplace from the homepage of Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure Marketplace from the homepage of Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Under "Everything", search for “POP3 connector”.
trans-unit.target: Under "Everything", search for “POP3 connector”.

trans-unit.source: Configure the POP3 connector as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the POP3 connector as follows:

trans-unit.source: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed
trans-unit.target: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed

trans-unit.source: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in
trans-unit.target: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in

trans-unit.source: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside
trans-unit.target: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside

trans-unit.source: **Web hosting plan** - select or create a web hosting plan
trans-unit.target: **Web hosting plan** - select or create a web hosting plan

trans-unit.source: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector
trans-unit.target: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector

trans-unit.source: **Name** - give a name for your POP3 Connector
trans-unit.target: **Name** - give a name for your POP3 Connector

trans-unit.source: Package settings
trans-unit.target: Package settings

trans-unit.source: **User Name** Specify the user name to connect to the POP3 Server
trans-unit.target: **User Name** Specify the user name to connect to the POP3 Server

trans-unit.source: **Password** Specify the password to connect to the POP3 Server
trans-unit.target: **Password** Specify the password to connect to the POP3 Server

trans-unit.source: **Server Address** Specify the POP3 Server name or IP address
trans-unit.target: **Server Address** Specify the POP3 Server name or IP address

trans-unit.source: **Server Port** Specify the POP3 Server port number
trans-unit.target: **Server Port** Specify the POP3 Server port number

trans-unit.source: **Enable SSL** Specify true to use POP3 over a secure SSL/TLS channel
trans-unit.target: **Enable SSL** Specify true to use POP3 over a secure SSL/TLS channel

trans-unit.source: Click on Create.
trans-unit.target: Click on Create.

trans-unit.source: A new POP3 Connector will be created.
trans-unit.target: A new POP3 Connector will be created.

trans-unit.source: Once the API app instance is created, you can create a logic App in the same resource group to use the POP3 connector.
trans-unit.target: Once the API app instance is created, you can create a logic App in the same resource group to use the POP3 connector.

trans-unit.source: Using the POP3 Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the POP3 Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the POP3 connector as a trigger for your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the POP3 connector as a trigger for your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you need to:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you need to:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group which has the POP3 connector.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group which has the POP3 connector.

trans-unit.source: Open “Triggers and Actions” to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow.
trans-unit.target: Open “Triggers and Actions” to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow.

trans-unit.source: The POP3 connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side.
trans-unit.target: The POP3 connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side.

trans-unit.source: Select that.
trans-unit.target: Select that.

trans-unit.source: You can drop the POP3 Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “POP3 Connector”.
trans-unit.target: You can drop the POP3 Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “POP3 Connector”.

trans-unit.source: You can now use POP3 connector in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can now use POP3 connector in the flow.

trans-unit.source: Select "Get Email" trigger and configure frequency and interval.
trans-unit.target: Select "Get Email" trigger and configure frequency and interval.

trans-unit.source: You can use the email retrieved from the POP3 trigger in other actions in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can use the email retrieved from the POP3 trigger in other actions in the flow.

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
